Name: Order of subject
column5: Dominant word order of subject, object and verb in a transitive clause (following definitions in Sinnemäki 2010).

Name: Order of subject and object
Description: Dominant word order of subject and object in a transitive clause (following definitions in Sinnemäki 2010).

Name: Order of subject
column5: Dominant word order of subject, object and verb in a transitive clause (following definitions in Dryer 2013).

Name: Order of subject with respect to object and verb
Description: Dominant word order of subject compared to object and verb in a transitive clause (following definitions in Sinnemäki 2010). Subject-first includes SVO and SOV.

Name: Morphological argument marking
Description: Head and/or dependent marking of lexical subject and/or object arguments, or some other consistent type of morphological marking.(Definitions are as in Sinnemäki 2010.)

Name: Head marking
Description: Head marking (mostly covering person, number, and gender agreement) of lexical subject and/or object arguments, on the predicate. Definitions are as in Sinnemäki (2010).

Name: Dependent marking
Description: Dependent marking (mostly covering case marking) of lexical subject and/or object arguments. Definitions are as in Sinnemäki (2010).
